com.systemj.netapi

Class TCPReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.systemj.netapi.InputSignal
      • com.systemj.netapi.TCPReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Runnable

    public class TCPReceiver
extends InputSignal
    This class is used to receive data from the output signal that implements com.systemj.ipc.TCPSender.

    Usage example: 

     
 TCPReceiver s = new TCPReceiver("127.0.0.1", 2000);
 
 // Sets a Consumer that prints the status and value of the signal O emitted from the clock-domain CD1
 s.setConsumer("CD1", "O", (status, value) -> System.out.println("Received : "+status+" "+value)); 
 s.close(); // close when necessary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TCPReceiver(String ip, int port)
      Create a TCPReceiver.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setConsumer(BiConsumer<Boolean,Object> c)
      Sets a BiConsumer which will be applied whenever the status of the output signal for sigName is updated by the clock-domain cdName.

      • TCPReceiver

        public TCPReceiver(String ip,
                   int port)
        Create a TCPReceiver.
        Parameters:
        ip - IP address of the server created by this TCPReceiver(java.lang.String, int).
        port - the port number of the server.

    • Method Detail

      • setConsumer

        public final void setConsumer(BiConsumer<Boolean,Object> c)
        Sets a BiConsumer which will be applied whenever the status of the output signal for sigName is updated by the clock-domain cdName.
        Parameters:
        c - the BiConsumer that accepts both a status and a value of this signal.
